channel.title: JEditorPane
channel.description:
Well... for some reason JEditorPane.setText(String); isn't working for me.. i have a method in my main class setPage(String); which reads from a url puts every line in a StringBuilder, and at the end of the method it runs JEditorPane.setText(String); with the build from the string builder, and nothing seems to happen to the pane. i added a println right after the setText so that it printed the build from the string builder, and it printed out the pages html code, i also added a println for the text in the pane, and it came out as : [code]

[/code] i think it might be because the pages contain javascript but i wouldent know :\

item.title: JEditorPane
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“Interdit, post:4, topic:178001”]You need to remove the META tags from the document, or rendering through setText will not work.

Try stripping your code with this method before using setText:

[code] private static String stripMetaTag(String text)
{
String textUpperCase = text.toUpperCase();

    int indexHead = textUpperCase.indexOf("<META ");
    int indexMeta = textUpperCase.indexOf("<META ");
    int indexBody = textUpperCase.indexOf("<BODY ");

    if (indexMeta == -1 || indexMeta > indexHead && indexMeta < indexBody)
        return text;

    int indexHeadEnd = textUpperCase.indexOf(">", indexMeta);

    return text.substring(0, indexMeta-1) + text.substring(indexHeadEnd+1);
}[/code][/quote]

Nice first post xD

Read full topic

item.title: JEditorPane
item.dc:creator: @Interdit Interdit
item.description:
@Interdit wrote:

You need to remove the META tags from the document, or rendering through setText will not work.

Try stripping your code with this method before using setText:

[code] private static String stripMetaTag(String text)
{
String textUpperCase = text.toUpperCase();

    int indexHead = textUpperCase.indexOf("<META ");
    int indexMeta = textUpperCase.indexOf("<META ");
    int indexBody = textUpperCase.indexOf("<BODY ");

    if (indexMeta == -1 || indexMeta > indexHead && indexMeta < indexBody)
        return text;

    int indexHeadEnd = textUpperCase.indexOf(">", indexMeta);

    return text.substring(0, indexMeta-1) + text.substring(indexHeadEnd+1);
}[/code]

Read full topic
